remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties.Category%2A> value is typically used as part of the application [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] to create labels for navigation controls.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets a value that represents the type of content that is contained in the .
Docs.value: The type of content that is contained in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Example <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties.ContentType%2A> values include "Whitepaper", "Security Bulletin", and "Exam".
This <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties.ContentType%2A> property is distinct from [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mime](~/includes/tlasharptla-mime-md.md)] content types as defined in RFC 2616.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties.Description%2A> may include but is not limited to: an abstract, table of contents, reference to a graphical representation of content, or a free-text account of the content.

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Dispose ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed
Public Sub Dispose ()
public: virtual void Dispose();
abstract member Dispose : unit -> unit override this.Dispose : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties>. The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties> in an unusable state. After calling <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties> was occupying. For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
> [!NOTE] > Always call <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties>. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties> object's `Finalize` method.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void Dispose (bool disposing);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub Dispose (disposing As Boolean)
protected: virtual void Dispose(bool disposing);
abstract member Dispose : bool -> unit override this.Dispose : bool -> unit

Docs.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the instance and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method. `Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties> references. This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

block.para:
can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to . For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Overriding the Finalize Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3).

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties.Revision%2A> property indicates the number of changed saves or revisions.
The application is responsible for updating the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.PackageProperties.Revision%2A> property value after each revision.
